description: This course is an in-depth look at the role of Behavioural Finance, the key behavioural biases, and how they may affect investor behaviors and responses, which in turn can affect both the equilibrium (or disequilibrium) pricing of financial assets. In light of the fact that consumption constitutes over 70% of the GDP in most countries, understanding what drives consumption patterns and behaviors is critical for banks and other financial institutions.
title: Behavioural Finance & Decision Making
